result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan L Wachel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court finds that Mr. Wachel is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp"

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: -- to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment within the first six months of the Probation term unless this is not possible due to incarceration, and if so, then as soon as possible after release from incareration; and to follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and from all non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed 
--to submit to random alcohol and drug screens, to occur not less than one month time per month; the Court indications that it prefers that the testing occurs more frequently than this if possible
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no direct or indirect contact with William Westphal or any of his family
--not to be present within 1000 feet of William Westphal's home
--to write a letter of apology to the Westphal family; to be submitted to the Agent within the first three months of the Probation term; this letter is then to be forwarded to the Westphal family if the letter is approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain  employment and/or education program as deemed appropriated by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 

Arresting Agency: WLPD


  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

timeConds.notes: to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, (no work-release), to commence forthwith

cases #14CF377 and #14CM193 called at 9:51am. [MK]
Defendant Nathan L Wachel in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #14CF377:  Mr. Wachel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial.  Service of Information admitted; reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties in count #1 are recited. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered in Case #14CF377 on Count #1 and in Case #14CM193 on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (one of the victims in Case #14CM193 is present) ; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Wachel guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4 in Case #14CF377.

In Case #14CF377 on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Wachel to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, consecutive to any sentences in being.  
The Court finds that Mr. Wachel is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

In Case #14CM193 on Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Wachel to 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to any sentences in being, with the exception that if Mr. Wachel is also revoked on Case #14CF377, then this six month Jail term is concurrent with Case #14CF377.  
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.


The Court STAYS these sentences and places Mr. Wachel on Probation for three years in Case #14CF377 and for one year in Case #14CM193. The Conditions of Probation (and Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked, with the exception of the conditional jail term) are: 
--in Case #14CF377 only:  to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, (no work-release), to commence forthwith
--to undergo AODA assessment within the first six months of the Probation term unless this is not possible due to incarceration, and if so, then as soon as possible after release from incareration; and to follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and from all non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed 
--to submit to random alcohol and drug screens, to occur not less than one month time per month; the Court indications that it prefers that the testing occurs more frequently than this if possible
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no direct or indirect contact with William Westphal or any of his family
--not to be present within 1000 feet of William Westphal's home
--to write a letter of apology to the Westphal family; to be submitted to the Agent within the first three months of the Probation term; this letter is then to be forwarded to the Westphal family if the letter is approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain  employment and/or education program as deemed appropriated by the Agent
--in Case #14CF377: to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--in case #14CF377: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in case #14CM193 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties are given. 
recess 10:22am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2014 at 09:45 am.

cases #14CF377 and #14CM193 called at 9:22am. [MK]
Defendant Nathan L Wachel appears via videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Karl Huebner, is present in the courtroom.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Huebner acknowledges that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that he has just realized this morning that the State made a plea offer on November 13th.   He has discussed the offer with Mr. Wachel and the Defense is accepting the offer. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 9:31am. 

NEXT:  schedule Plea/Sentencing on 12/23/14 at 9:45am. (State will submit a writ today)
Status conference on December 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

cases #14CF377 and #14CM193 called at 9:38am. [MK] 
Attorney Karl Huebner in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that he believes that Defendant Nathan Wachel is still in the Dane County Jail on a high cash bail. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. The Court informs the parties that if the case does not conclude on the December 19th date, this case will transfer by Judicial Rotation to Branch III/Judge Wambach on January 1st.
recess 9:40am. 

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference on 12/19/14 at 9:00am; arrangements are to be made for Mr. Wachel to appear by v/c from the Dane County Jail;  if Attorney Huebner determines that a change of plea is intended, he is to notify the DA's Office of this so that the State can prepare a writ
Attorney Karl Huebner
Pre-trial conference on November 5, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Status conference on November 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:48 pm
Defendant Nathan L Wachel in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Karl Huebner. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Huebner informs the Court that he was appointed by SPD on other matter for the defendant and it is believed that he will be appointed on this matter as well.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; felony charge and maximum penalties recited; reading of misdemeanor charges and penalties waived
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count # 1- #4.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with condition: 
- Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 10/30/14 at 2:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Huebner requests that this case be set for a status along with the defendant's other file instead of a preliminary hearing.
Court will set a status conference on 11/11/14 at 9:00 am with the defendant's other file.

Recess: 1:54 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 11/11/14 at 9:00 am
PTC:  11/514 at 10:20 am
